main event: A brilliant blueish light was observed by Dr. George A. Falkner in Covington, Ohio on multiple occasions over a two-month period in 1952.
interesting points: The object was tracked on a GCA (Ground Controlled Approach) scope for over 3 hours, remaining stationary at an altitude of 8 miles.
Other residents in the neighborhood, such as Mr. and Mrs. Pearl Etter, also reported seeing the same light in the past.
The light appeared to have a 'bobbing motion' but the witness could not estimate its distance.
The Air Force reported that the light was likely a B-29 aircraft testing photo equipment in the area.
The witness provided a sketch showing multiple disc-shaped objects in a horizontal row, with an arrow indicating the direction of travel.
sighted object: A brilliant blueish light in the sky
witnesses: Dr. George A. Falkner, Mr. and Mrs. Pearl Etter
